content:
In a few days, I am moving to Reykjavik to start my postgraduate program!
I don't believe many other Lean users will be in the area, but I figured it wouldn't hurt to start a thread.

I have training in programming and differential geometry, and am currently using Lean to prove some theorems in algebraic geometry. I will also be completing a masters/PhD with Tarmo Uustalu in the distributed systems space :)
Welcome to Reykjavik! Let me know when you're here and we'll meet up! I've met your advisor once -- I'm at the other university but it's just a five minute bike ride away.
Hey! I'm going to be in Reykjavik from October as a Postdoc at the University of Reykjavik, also working with Tarmo. Looking forward to meeting everyone there!

Hi, i'm going to Reykjavik for FroCoS/ITP/TABLEAUX '25 from 26 of September to 3 of October
I guess that there are a lot of people from this Zulip that are going
Also, if somebody is interested in sharing accommodation, I'm interested
And also, if somebody has suggestions about accommodations I'm interested
I know some people are going (e.g., every paper which has been accepted to ITP will have some author go). Probably, they're not reading this thread.
Note in particular that there will be a Lean workshop, which is currently accepting submissions: https://leanprover-community.github.io/itp-2025-lean-workshop/

Hi
Does anyone here knows if it is already possible to read the papers that will be presented at ITP? Googling the titles I can find some in arXiv or other websites, but I was wondering if there is an official website with all of them?
Is this a good channel for asking things about ITP, or there is a better channel?
I wouldn't expect messages about ITP itself here.
A message "I'm based in Rejkjavik, anybody interested in having a coffee on <day ITP ends>" would, in my opinion, be in scope.

Iván Renison said:

Does anyone here knows if it is already possible to read the papers that will be presented at ITP?

The ITP 2025 proceedings have been published today.
